thread.title: Final freeway closure in progress as Chinese president leaves...
thread.title_full: Final freeway closure in progress as Chinese president leaves... | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Final freeway closure in progress as Chinese president leaves...
text:
LIVE UPDATES:
7:42 a.m: Seattle police on standby outside Westin Hotel for Chinese President's departure
7:36 a.m: WSDOT traffic cameras go dark
7:23 a.m: The I-5 express lanes have closed.
The traffic headaches caused by the Chinese president's visit are nearly over.
President Xi Jinping leaves downtown Seattle Thursday morning for the last time, but it will happen during the heart of the morning commute.
MAP: See a map of where the Chinese president has gone PHOTOS: See dozens of photos of the Chinese President's visit TRAFFIC ALERTS: Download the KIRO 7 mobile app to get traffic push alerts Watch this story for live updates when Xi leaves Seattle Details: Aside from traffic, what did Xi do in Seattle and Tacoma ? He's headed to Paine Field in Everett where he'll catch a flight to Washington, D.C.
Xi is scheduled to meet with Vice President Joe Biden in Washington, D.C. at 2 p.m. Pacific Time. Currently, his motorcade has not left the Westin Hotel in downtown Seattle.
Restictions around Westin Hotel continue until #ChinesePresident leaves later this morning- 4th, Olive, 7th, Lenora. pic.twitter.com/YtHJ4OWLlK
— Alexis Smith (@AlexisKIRO7) September 24, 2015 Drivers who were stuck in Wednesday's traffic jam kept asking -- was it really worth it?
“What is he – helping with our economy? Is he, is there anything on the local level that he’s helping us with?” said Christopher Johnston, who was stuck in traffic.
President Xi visited Everett’s Boeing plant Wednesday morning and announced a $38 billion deal for China to buy 300 Boeing 787 jets. Read more here .
Boeing officials hope that will bring a boost to job growth at the Everett plant.
Still, frustrated drivers didn’t seem to care while they were caught in gridlock during the afternoon commute. Many took to Twitter to voice their concerns. Read some of the comments here .
Are we sure the #ChinesePresident isn't just messing us up to make the opening of the 405 toll lanes look fine by comparison?
— Christina Dudley (@CNDudley) September 23, 2015 “WA state should pass law banning motorcades from shutting down freeways during rush hour!” Tweeted Jim Harrigill.
During his visit, Xi addressed Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, billionaire investor Warren Buffett and other top American and Chinese business leaders, vowing that his country would work to remove barriers to foreign investment and improve intellectual property protections.
He also toured Microsoft with Mark Zuckerberg and Bezos and visited Lincoln High School in Tacoma. Read more about his time in Puget Sound here .
But the Chinese president was also met by human rights protesters at every city he visited and outside the Westin Hotel where he stayed.
Tibetans of Washington tell me they want corporate CEOs not to put profits ahead of human rights #ChinesePresident pic.twitter.com/AMfn5wXhs6
— Natasha Chen (@NatashaKIRO7) September 23, 2015 After leaving Seattle, Xi will attend a White House state dinner on Friday.
Obama last week said he would tell Xi that China must reform and transform its economy.
"You can't simply pursue an export-driven strategy, because you're too big," Obama said. "You're not going to be able to grow your economy at the same pace over the next 20 years that you did in the last 20 years."
